document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Science - Kindergarten

E3B3B40B04FD4B49A9F664A00F2F5E82.description: observe changes that are part of a simple life cycle of a plant: seed, seedling, plant, flower, and fruit.

216970B8C712411D9394C05134C113EA.description: identify ways that young plants resemble the parent plant; and

2ECA868356C141BF830E2C5214ABFE29.description: identify basic parts of plants and animals;

5FE6FD58B67743EB978C3B112A025B1A.description: sort plants and animals into groups based on physical characteristics such as color, size, body covering, or leaf shape;

9FAC1305BE8C4469A586ACA597BE088B.description: The student knows that organisms resemble their parents and have structures and processes that help them survive within their environments. The student is expected to:

EE5EC8DB6B264FFD81D918C37C60E6BF.description: examine evidence that living organisms have basic needs such as food, water, and shelter for animals and air, water, nutrients, sunlight, and space for plants.

D44D8AC411084AB7A28D96385400F4DF.description: differentiate between living and nonliving things based upon whether they have basic needs and produce offspring; and

ED43912A0A9940128452BAA65904BAED.description: The student knows that plants and animals have basic needs and depend on the living and nonliving things around them for survival. The student is expected to:

1FE4E2EA3D934CECBE5340D0D8088184.description: observe, describe, and illustrate objects in the sky such as the clouds, Moon, and stars, including the Sun.

F4D135610EBC4144B3FC94A54E3A58ED.description: identify events that have repeating patterns, including seasons of the year and day and night; and

04D932B56C4F4FE9BE1CD31B5166924C.description: observe and describe weather changes from day to day and over seasons;

14F8EFBDD2394EF9B912190A0B0B7599.description: The student knows that there are recognizable patterns in the natural world and among objects in the sky. The student is expected to:

869D0584FA4848309A0007792C5179C9.description: give examples of ways rocks, soil, and water are useful.

1D7F877112264459B4CB66946202F859.description: observe and describe physical properties of natural sources of water, including color and clarity; and

72F084A2374848D282CC8B18694DDEE0.description: observe, describe, and sort rocks by size, shape, color, and texture;

53CA891817224E7B8115EAC3EACE71CE.description: The student knows that the natural world includes earth materials. The student is expected to:

63E8F75DF363486AB804C9177CBCC9CC.description: observe and describe the ways that objects can move such as in a straight line, zigzag, up and down, back and forth, round and round, and fast and slow.

F556FC3129884EE3BCADAB346DCB15F7.description: observe and describe the location of an object in relation to another such as above, below, behind, in front of, and beside; and

D6975917A43E4DC3BB81FC0BEE72B517.description: explore interactions between magnets and various materials;

914585F36AC042ACA8B92EE24FCECC27.description: use the senses to explore different forms of energy such as light, thermal, and sound;

CD379331543247C884E0C8A82BDFFB81.description: The student knows that energy, force, and motion are related and are a part of their everyday life. The student is expected to:

89AA70BD86F64648970233747FF03387.description: observe, record, and discuss how materials can be changed by heating or cooling.

31696F945FFF4E5E97C986C8C8E3BAA9.description: observe and record properties of objects, including bigger or smaller, heavier or lighter, shape, color, and texture; and

2B152D6AD14F45549438A434FB0E5CD5.description: The student knows that objects have properties and patterns. The student is expected to:

5E963DE6163648408EE51181732E2004.description: use the senses as a tool of observation to identify properties and patterns of organisms, objects, and events in the environment.

CD5C495D7497410ABD28A45C0CDF7F84.description: collect information using tools, including computing devices, hand lenses, primary balances, cups, bowls, magnets, collecting nets, and notebooks; timing devices; non-standard measuring items; weather instruments such as demonstration thermometers; and materials to support observations of habitats of organisms such as terrariums and aquariums; and

5DC9BB8C68F340B2A41BE623A12A6A15.description: The student uses age-appropriate tools and models to investigate the natural world. The student is expected to:

223A7C45E55248AAA674264599DF1181.description: explore that scientists investigate different things in the natural world and use tools to help in their investigations.

D94B4D7E06F2434D840BDC47580BDC39.description: make predictions based on observable patterns in nature; and

683A82CD441340249CFFD633FE1CA051.description: identify and explain a problem such as the impact of littering and propose a solution;

5052B33D5C5A4CC0BAC93AFB0FDE3704.description: The student knows that information and critical thinking are used in scientific problem solving. The student is expected to:

EAE7425A7F7548A1804AA201E001CDB1.description: communicate observations about simple descriptive investigations.

3616B20509614AE98E52A36E05FA54B9.description: record and organize data and observations using pictures, numbers, and words; and

F223078F1C5541AC8E4BB21A85720204.description: collect data and make observations using simple tools;

6A156E337E11403B900E372CDEF5AA24.description: plan and conduct simple descriptive investigations;

026889519BE84E8EA4AE6BEAF84916C9.description: ask questions about organisms, objects, and events observed in the natural world;

C88A5EE409C544E290D184F928BCB6C5.description: The student develops abilities to ask questions and seek answers in classroom and outdoor investigations. The student is expected to:

2EEC76B9191943D0A5E211CD381F2119.description: demonstrate how to use, conserve, and dispose of natural resources and materials such as conserving water and reusing or recycling paper, plastic, and metal.

D9A73E2518B54734BC06E20D99AC992A.description: identify, discuss, and demonstrate safe and healthy practices as outlined in Texas Education Agency-approved safety standards during classroom and outdoor investigations, including wearing safety goggles or chemical splash goggles, as appropriate, washing hands, and using materials appropriately; and

230D53CDA26A439DBFF6717A7BB85BEC.description: The student conducts classroom and outdoor investigations following home and school safety procedures and uses environmentally appropriate and responsible practices. The student is expected to:
